I saw that in v1.6 of Pkg `] generate` is deprecated. Am I the only one who heavily uses this feature? :thinking_face:

I was looking through the code to see how easy it would be to change `generate` to handle names that end in “.jl” (rather than give the error “not a valid package name”), and I was surprised to see that it’s deprecated.

PkgTemplates is great of course, but it’s a bit heavy weight, sometimes you just want to create a completely minimal package…

text:
The following should be good enough to create a minimal package from the shell… a bit ugly and probably brittle though
```jlgen() {
  if [ -z "$*" ]
  then
    echo "USAGE: jlgen <PkgName>"
    return
  fi
  local pkgname="${1%.jl}"
  local pkguuid=$(uuidgen | awk '{print tolower($0);}')
  mkdir -p $1/src
  printf "name = \"$pkgname\"\nuuid = \"$pkguuid\"\nversion = \"0.1.0\"\n" > $1/Project.toml
  printf "module $pkgname\nend\n" > $1/src/$pkgname.jl
}```
